com.gdxgame.core

Class GameMenuPage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gdxgame.core.GameMenuPage

  • public abstract class GameMenuPage
extends Object
    GameMenuPage is one of the core classes for Label based keyboard menus. It contains different options that can be selected by the user. It uses the libgdx Table class to have an actor for the stage attribute of the GameMenu and to automatically layout the options(=Labels) in a specified manner.
    It also uses the libgdx Skin class in order to define properties how the options should look like (font,color,background,...). A skin consists of a JSON file that describes the properties how options should look like and of a TextureAtlas containing graphics of the skin.

    A GameMenuPage is configured (=which class defines the page, which skin is used and the page's background image) within the GameMenuPageType enum.

    A Skin is configured within the SkinType enum.

    • Method Detail

      • addOption

        public void addOption(String label,
                      boolean enabled,
                      Label.LabelStyle style,
                      int padTop,
                      int padRight,
                      int padBottom,
                      int padLeft)
        adds an option to the menu page. Each menu page must have at least one option. An option can either be enabled or disabled.

        If it is disabled then it will be ignored for the GameMenu.increaseSelection() and GameMenu.decreaseSelection() calls and for the getInitialOptionIndex() method.
        Parameters:
        label - text of the option
        enabled - true to enable the option. false to disable the option and to exclude it from the increase-/decreaseSelection() and getInitialOptioinIndex() calls
        style - LabelStyle of the option taken from the skin
        padTop - top padding of the option
        padRight - right padding of the option
        padBottom - bottom padding of the option
        padLeft - left padding of the option

      • addOption

        public void addOption(String label,
                      boolean enabled,
                      int padTop,
                      int padRight,
                      int padBottom,
                      int padLeft)
        Similar like addOption(String, boolean, com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Label.LabelStyle, int, int, int, int). The difference is that it automatically uses the "default" LabelStyle of the skin.
        Parameters:
        label - text of the option
        enabled - true to enable the option. false to disable the option and to exclude it from the increase-/decreaseSelection() and getInitialOptioinIndex() calls
        padTop - top padding of the option
        padRight - right padding of the option
        padBottom - bottom padding of the option
        padLeft - left padding of the option

      • enableOption

        public void enableOption(int optionIndex,
                         boolean enabled,
                         Label.LabelStyle style)
        Enables or disables an option of the menu page.

        If it is disabled then it will be ignored for the GameMenu.increaseSelection() and GameMenu.decreaseSelection() calls and for the getInitialOptionIndex() method.
        Parameters:
        optionIndex - index of option that should be enabled/disabled. Must be greater or equal 0 and options.size()
        enabled - true to enable an option. false to disable an option.
        style - new LabelStyle that should be used for the option

      • initialize

        public abstract void initialize()
        automatically called from the constructor of the GameMenuPage class. Use it to make calls to the addOption(String, boolean, int, int, int, int) method to add options to the page.
        A page must contain at least one option.

      • update

        public void update(float deltaTime)
        automatically called by the GameMenu.update(float) method if the page is the current active one. Use it to update any page logic.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - time passed since last frame

      • render

        public void render(SpriteBatch spriteBatch)
        automatically called by the GameMenu.render(SpriteBatch) method if the page is the current active one. Use it to customize the rendering of the page.
        Parameters:
        spriteBatch - reference to the GDXGame SpriteBatch to draw things

      • getInitialOptionIndex

        public int getInitialOptionIndex()
        Returns the option index of the menu page that should be automatically selected when the page gets active. Per default this method returns the first enabled option of the options array.
        Returns:
        option index of option that should be selected when the page gets active

      • processSelection

        public abstract void processSelection(int optionIndex)
        automatically called by the GameMenu.update(float) method if the page is the current active one. Use it to handle the logic of the given option index.
        Parameters:
        optionIndex - index of option that should be processed

      • keyDown

        public boolean keyDown(int optionIndex,
                       int keyOrButtonCode)
        automatically called by the GameMenu.keyDown(int) method if the page is the current active one. Use it to handle the logic of keyboard or controller events.
        Parameters:
        optionIndex - index of option that should be processed
        keyOrButtonCode - code of pressed key or button
        Returns:
        true if event was successfully handled. false otherwise.

      • keyUp

        public boolean keyUp(int optionIndex,
                     int keyOrButtonCode)
        automatically called by the GameMenu.keyUp(int) method if the page is the current active one. Use it to handle the logic of keyboard or controller events.
        Parameters:
        optionIndex - index of option that should be processed
        keyOrButtonCode - code of pressed key or button
        Returns:
        true if event was successfully handled. false otherwise.
